result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard H Rich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the West Allis Full Service Car Wash at 2850 S. 108th St. while the victim is still an employee.
No contact with Jennifer R.

Defendant may leave the State to visit his mother in Waterloo, Iowa with the agent's written permission.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard H Rich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 30  days at the House of Correction with Huber for work.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 12  months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) no contact with the West Allis Full Service Car Wash at 2850 S. 108th St. while the victim is still an employee; 4) no contact with Jennifer R.; 5) defendant may leave the State to visit his mother in Waterloo, Iowa with the agent's written permission.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

Amended Complaint received and filed.   Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Complaint and waives reading.  Court finds probable cause the defendant committed the offense.  Court AMENDS the charge to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1) a Class B misdemeanor.  Court further amends the Amended Complaint to reflect the victim's corrent initials.

Defendant Richard H Rich in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Court states this is a misdemeanor case and an Information should not be filed.  State withdraws the Amended Information.

Defendant Richard H Rich in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard H Rich in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLS; and  West Allis Full Service Car Wash located at 2850 S. 108th Street in West Allis, Wisconsin.

Defendant Richard H Rich in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 44  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-13-2015 at 1:30pm
